column4: I heard one of the latest releases of Ubuntu uses (or will use) ext4 by default. Does this apply when one updates to that release, or only to a clean install?
no, you can convert to ext4 you do not get the full benefit of ext4 witha converted fs
sudo apt-get install xfce4    will give you just the DE if that's what you desire
xubuntu-desktop will give you ALL the default apps in Xubuntu as well
